TopicTitle: Challenging YouTubers! w/ HOCgaming and TheMattDennis - Submission Thread

Articles.Content: Build a rocket (or use a stock rocket, which ever you choose) and make it into orbit of Kerbin while staying in cockpit view (Kerbal view) the entire time. If you think it would be to hard you could allow map view. Hope to see this in the next episode.
Create an amphibious vehicle with an attached plane. Drive to the start of the dirt runway and then proceed to launch a plane back.
Launch a ship that has a rover and go to the sun and drive on it and then return the ship to kerbin
Build a ship and rover to send to the sun and land on it drive the rover around and then fly and land the ship back at ksc
Land on every plant in the kerbal solar systom and back with out the devopers consle (sorry about the misspelled words)

How about boating around Kerbin with nothing but a solar powered boat? You could make it another charity drive.

http://grist.org/list/this-boat-circled-the-globe-on-sun-power-alone/

Don't have to worry about mountains at sea.

Edit : OK, maybe not around the whole planet but make a boat powered by solar panels only would be cool.

Edited August 12, 2013 by Valley
Speaking of reliant robin's youÃ¯Â»Â¿ should attempt to recreate the Top Gear Reliant Robin Space Shuttle.

Quick simple Crash into the Sun first to do it wins

p.s Love the series I watch your vids and recomend you to my freinds who like ksp
Who can make the best Kerbal Cannon?

Launch Pad Challenge: make a stock parts "launch pad" with a rocket attached to it. Launch your launch pad and rocket and land the launch pad on a different continent. Then you must re-launch from your new launch pad and get into a stable orbit. First one to do so wins.

Edited August 15, 2013 by Kmuster
Make a space plane and land on minmus :-) with no main sail or skipper

Compete in the No-engined flyer challenge

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/44582-The-no-engined-flyer-challenge%21

I dont know if this idea has been posted yet:

Try to go into as low a CIRCULAR solar orbit as you can. So whoever gets closest to the sun wins. You will need to build some interesting ships

Last video you nearly nailed my suggestions.

So: How about to launch a spaceplane towards a polar orbit (witch one is not essential; min 70km by 70km altitude fully orbit initial), then alter the course and land at the KSC-runway 09?

Challenge 1: Design a 2 wheeled planed that takes off and land on two wheels. landing can be anywhere and it cannot be vtol or vertical.

Challenge 2: Design a flying Wing {it cannot have any tail or any rudders on the tips of the wings} you must take off and fly to the end of the runway then make a turn around the whole space center and land back on the runway in one piece.

Edited August 30, 2013 by josea74
Design a rover that can traverse through water, go over rugged terrain and fly into the sky. Building time not included.

Build a boat that can get to the second runway and back to KSC, fastest mission time wins.

Rules:

1. Maximum part count of 30 parts

2. No air breathing engines

3. No external seats

4. Everything you start with must still be attached when you finish (no staging to ditch excess weight)

5. You must plant a flag on the dirt runway

Good Luck

And a new proposual:

Build a rocket with a one or three man capusule that is lauched on a 90 or 270 degree path. Achive at least a 80 by 80 km altitude for the orbit. So far so easy.

Then perform a descend burn at 80 km or higher altitude and detatch the capsule. Only the capsule and it's parachutes are allowed to enter the atmosphere. Try to to land as close as possible to the KSC-lauchpad.

Rules:

All kinds of parachutes (Normal, drouge, radial) are allowed, there behavior may be altered through action-groups. The woman - or man - who lands savely nearest the KSC-lauchpad wins.

You must reach orbit do one orbit and land, but you can't use liquid fuel you can use:

Solid fuel

Boosters

Decouples
That would be too hard
Make a space plane and send it into an orbit around kerban and safely land back on water.

Make a really low orbiting spy satellite to take "photos" of for example KSC. So it obviously needs to be fueled to return safely on orbit to be able remake this operation again (after refueling).

More details: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/47029-Kerbin-Low-Orbiting-Spy-Satellite-KLOSS
Send a Kerbal into the wilderness on Kerbin, over 200 km from KSC. Deliver, rescue and return him to KSC without using wings or air-breathing engines. 2 craft limit.

Fly a mk 1 command pod up to 5000 meters with nothing but a docking port and a parachute(s). Then, dock with it with another (different) craft whilst it's free-falling. Winner is the one with the least attempts before success. If it's too hard change the height. If it's too easy put the docking ports on the top rather than the bottom

Fly a mk 1 command pod up to 5000 meters with nothing but a docking port and a parachute(s). Then, dock with it with another (different) craft whilst it's free-falling. Winner is the one with the least attempts before success. If it's too hard change the height. If it's too easy put the docking ports on the top rather than the bottom

While this sounds fun crafts despawn after a 2.5km gap (as we saw in the last real episode). This means the maximum gap you'd be able to have is 2.5km.
